content.text: This section establishes the framework for developing and maintaining external partnerships that enhance student learning opportunities and prepare students for post-secondary success. Eduversal Partner Schools are committed to creating meaningful pathways that connect students with universities, employers, cultural institutions, and alumni networks, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for their chosen futures. The external partnerships and student pathways program supports the achievement of Schoolwide Learner Outcomes (SLOs), particularly Academic Excellence, Global Competence, Communication, and Innovation, while aligning with CIS Domain F (Community Partnerships) and WASC Category E (School Culture and Support for Student Learning).

content.title: Guiding Principles
items: Student-Centered: All partnerships prioritize student benefit, learning outcomes, and future opportunities
Ethical Engagement: Partnerships maintain transparency, avoid conflicts of interest, and uphold school values
Equity and Access: All students, regardless of background or financial circumstances, have access to pathway support
EAL-Inclusive: Programs accommodate students whose first language is not English, providing appropriate support and resources
Data-Informed: Decisions are based on student outcomes, destination tracking, and partnership effectiveness data
Sustainable: Partnerships are built for long-term mutual benefit rather than short-term gains

content.title: Scope of External Partnerships
items: Higher Education Institutions: Indonesian and international universities, polytechnics, and vocational institutions
Industry and Business: Companies offering internships, work experience, and career insights
Professional Organizations: Bodies providing certifications, competitions, and professional development
Cultural Institutions: Museums, galleries, libraries, and cultural centers supporting educational programs
NGOs and Community Organizations: Partners supporting service learning, community engagement, and social impact
Alumni Network: Graduates contributing through mentorship, career guidance, and school support

content.text: The university counseling program provides comprehensive support for students preparing for tertiary education, ensuring they are equipped to navigate Indonesian and international university admissions processes successfully.

content.title: Program Structure and Roles
items: Director of College Counselling: Develops network-wide university counseling strategies, coordinates with College Counsellors, fosters partnerships with universities and admissions organizations, monitors network-wide university placement outcomes, and organizes cross-school workshops and university fairs

College Counsellor: Guides individual students through the university application process, conducts one-on-one counseling sessions with students and parents, organizes school-level workshops, university visits, and information sessions, monitors application progress and outcomes for school students, and coordinates with class teachers on academic preparation and documentation

Secondary School Principal: Oversees integration of university counseling with academic programs, supports College Counsellor in resource allocation and scheduling, reviews university placement outcomes as part of school quality metrics

content.title: Counseling Program Timeline
rows: Career awareness through curriculum connections, introduction to career sectors and job families, guest speaker program, field trips to workplaces and industry sites
Career exploration aligned with IGCSE subject choices, aptitude and personality assessments, job shadowing opportunities, introduction to entrepreneurship
In-depth career research and planning, work experience placements, industry mentorship program, career fair participation and networking

content.title: Application Platform Support
items: UCAS (UK): Personal statement development, reference writing, predicted grade preparation, interview preparation, deadline management
Common Application (USA): Essay writing support, activities list development, counselor recommendation, financial aid application guidance, Early Decision/Early Action strategy
Indonesian National Systems: SNBP and SNBT test registration and preparation support, Mandiri application guidance, transcript preparation
Other Systems: Direct university applications for Australia, Singapore, Europe; portfolio development for art programs; audition preparation for performing arts

content.title: EAL Considerations in University Counseling
items: English proficiency test preparation (IELTS, TOEFL, Duolingo)
Essay support with awareness of language development stages
University recommendations considering EAL context
Information about foundation/pathway programs
Bilingual parent communication
Connections with universities offering strong EAL support services

content.title: Counseling Documentation and Records
items: Maintain records of student counseling sessions
Track application progress and outcomes
Document communication with universities and stakeholders

content.text: Career guidance prepares students for the world of work, whether through direct employment, vocational training, or university-to-career pathways.

content.title: Career Education Framework
items: Lower Secondary (Grade 7-8): Career awareness, introduction to career sectors and job families, guest speaker program, field trips to workplaces and industry sites
Upper Secondary (Grade 9-10): Career exploration, aptitude and personality assessments, job shadowing opportunities, introduction to entrepreneurship
Advanced Level (Grade 11-12): In-depth career research and planning, work experience placements, industry mentorship program, career fair participation and networking

content.title: Work Experience Program
steps: Understanding workplace culture and professional behavior
Post-placement activities including reflection journal/report, presentation to peers, thank you letter to host organization, evaluation of placement for future students

content.title: Industry Partnerships for Career Development
items: Identify potential partners aligned with school values and student interests
Initial approach and relationship building
Partnership proposal with clear benefits and expectations
MOU development
Program implementation and monitoring
Annual review and renewal

content.text: Schools develop formal partnerships with universities to enhance student opportunities, including guaranteed interview or conditional acceptance programs, campus visits, and professor guest lectures.

content.title: University Partnerships
items: Guaranteed interview or conditional acceptance programs
Campus visits and taster sessions for students
Professor guest lectures and academic enrichment
Scholarship programs for Eduversal students
Research collaboration opportunities
Recognition of Cambridge qualifications

content.title: Professional and Industry Organization Partnerships
items: Partnerships with professional bodies supporting student development and career preparation

content.title: NGO and Community Partnerships
items: Partnerships aligned with SLO: Ethical Leadership
Student-led community service projects
Integration with Profil Pelajar Pancasila competencies
Reflection and documentation of learning

content.text: The alumni network is a valuable resource for current students and the school community, providing mentorship, career guidance, and community connection.

content.title: Alumni Program Structure
items: Alumni Coordinator: Maintains comprehensive alumni database, plans and executes alumni engagement events, coordinates mentorship program, facilitates alumni contributions to school programs, manages alumni communications, tracks and celebrates alumni achievements
Alumni Association: Formal structure with elected board, annual general meeting, working committees, constitution and governance aligned with school policies

content.title: Alumni Engagement Programs
items: Mentorship program matching alumni with current students
Career advice, university guidance, skill development activities

content.title: Alumni Data Management
items: Database contents include contact information, graduation year, university attended, current profession, engagement history
Privacy and consent required for inclusion in database, annual data verification and update requests

content.title: Alumni and Business Relationships
items: Fair and transparent procurement policies
Equal opportunity for alumni-owned businesses to compete for contracts
No preferential treatment based solely on alumni status

content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools are committed to ensuring that financial constraints do not prevent students from accessing higher education opportunities.

content.title: Scholarship Information and Support
items: Maintain updated database of scholarship opportunities
Notify eligible students of relevant scholarships
Provide application guidance and essay review
Coordinate recommendation letters
Track application outcomes

content.title: Financial Aid Awareness
items: Understanding total cost of attendance
Types of financial aid available
Application processes for financial aid
Negotiating financial aid packages
Comparing offers across universities

content.title: School-Based Financial Support
items: Tuition assistance for qualifying families
Emergency education fund for crisis situations
Textbook and materials support
Transportation assistance
Examination fee support

content.text: All formal external partnerships require appropriate approval and are documented through Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs).

content.title: MOU Template
items: Parties: Full legal names of school and partner organization
Purpose: Clear statement of partnership objectives
Scope: Specific activities and programs covered
Duration: Start date, end date, renewal provisions
Responsibilities: Detailed obligations of each party
Resources: Financial contributions, in-kind support, staffing
Intellectual Property: Ownership of materials created
Confidentiality: Data sharing and privacy requirements
Safeguarding: Child protection commitments
Liability: Insurance requirements, indemnification
Termination: Conditions for ending partnership
Dispute Resolution: Process for addressing disagreements
Signatories: Authorized representatives of each party

content.title: Partnership Review and Evaluation
items: Achievement of stated objectives
Student participation and outcomes
Resource utilization and cost-effectiveness
Alignment with school values and strategic priorities
Stakeholder feedback
Safeguarding compliance
Partner satisfaction

content.text: Schools track graduate destinations to evaluate program effectiveness and inform improvement.

content.title: Destination Data Collection
items: Initial: At graduation (intended destination)
6-month follow-up: Confirmed enrollment/employment
Annual survey: 1, 3, 5 years post-graduation

content.title: Destination Data Analysis and Use
items: University acceptance rates by institution type
Scholarship success rates
Correlation between academic performance and destinations
Impact of counseling program on outcomes
Comparison across cohorts and schools

content.title: Reporting and Communication
items: Annual destination report to Board and Yayasan
Termly updates to SLT on application progress
Summary statistics in school profile and marketing

content.text: Key performance indicators are used to evaluate the effectiveness of university counseling, partnerships, and alumni engagement.

content.title: KPIs
items: University counseling KPIs: University acceptance rates, scholarship success rates
Partnership KPIs: Partnership satisfaction, student participation
Alumni engagement KPIs: Alumni event attendance, mentorship program participation

content.text: The school maintains a portfolio of evidence and artifacts to support accreditation, including university placement data, counseling records, and partnership MOUs.

content.title: Evidence Portfolio Contents
items: University placement data (3-year trend)
Sample counseling records (anonymized)
Partnership MOUs (active)
Career fair programs and evaluations
Work experience placement records
Alumni database statistics
Mentorship program documentation
Student and parent satisfaction surveys
Destination tracking reports

content.text: Implementation responsibilities are defined across various roles within the school to ensure effective execution of external partnerships and pathways.

content.title: Role Summary
items: Director of College Counselling: Oversees university counseling strategies and partnerships.
College Counsellor: Provides direct support to students in the application process.
Secondary School Principal: Ensures integration of counseling with academic programs.

content.title: Annual Planning Cycle
items: Review of partnership effectiveness and student outcomes.
Planning for workshops and engagement events.
Evaluation of counseling program and adjustments based on feedback.

content.text: Compliance with relevant regulations and standards is essential for the successful operation of external partnerships and pathways.

content.title: Compliance Areas
items: Adherence to data protection regulations.
Safeguarding protocols for student involvement in partnerships.
Regular review of partnership agreements and MOUs.
